title: TheLastStoic
author: TheLastStoic
content: "Society is a complex and ever-evolving entity, shaped by the actions and decisions of the people who live within it. But while most of us seek to contribute to the common good and work towards the betterment of our communities, there are those who seek to manipulate and control society for their own gain. These are the politicians, who wield power and influence over the lives of their constituents, often using their positions to further their own agendas and interests.Throughout history, politicians have used their power and influence to manipulate and control their own people, often at the expense of the common good. Whether through propaganda, fear-mongering, or the manipulation of information, politicians have proven themselves to be skilled at shaping public opinion and manipulating the masses for their own benefit. We must examine the ways in which politicians have used their power to manipulate and control society, and the consequences of these actions for the people they purport to serve explore the history of political manipulation, from ancient civilizations to modern day, and examine the ways in which politicians have used their power to further their own interests and agendas. Consider the ways in which we, as members of society, can resist manipulation and work towards a more public repository of information for "The People". Thanks to the innovators who laid the groundwork now it's our turn to fill this thing.  "SATOSHISATOSHISAT"Shift19"Jssp dyi loo vyvyn"

I think citizen should learn how to demand more from those political players and make sure a system that is people oriented is enshrined in the constitution.Everyday we keep lamenting over the abuse of power by the political class but it is becoming clearer everyday that they are not willing to change. When the citizens protest or try to resist this political oppression, they are victimized, jailed and sometimes killed. The political situation in Iran, Nigeria, Afghanistan, Myanmar, etc are clear indications that the government doesn't respect the rights of the people. In my country the government claim that there is insufficient funds to finance key projects but they have refused to cut the cost of governance. They have reduced workers salaries but our legislatures are one of the highest paid globally. But one day the the people would be willing to give anything including thier lives to claim back thier freedom and rights. There would be a revolution that would force these unpatriotic political class out of office and the commons would take back what belongs to them. Until then, we would be patient and hardworking in a bid to survive.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: In everything you've said about the politicians who govern us today, you've made a valid point. To bring all of this to a halt or reduce it to a manageable level, we must be proactive in every step we take to combat it. One of them is the populace's ignorance. In a country where the votes of the masses decide who becomes the next leader and a cup full of the masses are illiterate or ignorant, there is a major problem with the government we are voting for. When the government does not pay attention to the educational sector of the country, particularly in rural areas, I believe it fosters illiteracy and its all to their own gain as they can say and unsay to persuade the illiterate ones easily. I hope more of the masses become educated to make a change in the society.
